repository.name: telecom_customer_churn_ml
repository.description: Telecommunications customer churn prediction and lifetime value optimization. POPIA-compliant with ICASA (Independent Communications Authority of SA) consumer protection alignment. Uses MSSQL (billing and CRM), MySQL (network operations), MongoDB (customer interactions), PostgreSQL (product catalog), and S3 (call detail records). 4 entities: Subscriber, MobileDevice, ServicePlan, and NetworkSession. Supports ML models for churn prediction, upsell targeting, and network experience optimization with full explainability and fairness monitoring.

nodes.name: Billing and CRM SQL Server

dbType.name: SQL Server
dbType.sparkPattern: MS JDBC with Always Encrypted for payment data

nodes.description: Customer master data, billing history, payments, and CRM interactions
nodes.accessProcess:
1. Customer analytics governance approval
2. POPIA direct marketing consent verification
3. ICASA consumer protection compliance check
4. SQL Server read replica with audit
5. Payment card industry (PCI) scoping review

details.notes:
Debezium for billing event streaming
POPIA: Direct marketing opt-in required
ICASA: Consumer protection regulations
PCI: Payment data tokenized, not in features
Encryption: Always Encrypted for sensitive fields
Retention: Account lifetime + 5 years

nodes.sparkPattern: MS JDBC with Always Encrypted for payment data

nodes.name: Network Operations MySQL

dbType.name: MySQL
dbType.defaultProcess: Network analytics access with NOC approval
dbType.sparkPattern: JDBC with SSL and network data aggregation

nodes.description: Network performance, cell tower data, and service quality metrics
nodes.accessProcess:
1. NOC manager approval for customer analytics
2. Network data privacy review
3. MySQL read replica with SSL
4. Aggregation requirements (no individual CDRs)

details.notes:
Percona with performance monitoring
Debezium for network event alerts
Data: Aggregated QoS scores, not individual CDRs
ICASA: QoS reporting compliance
Retention: 90 days raw, 2 years aggregated
Privacy: Location approximated to cell area

nodes.sparkPattern: JDBC with SSL and network data aggregation

nodes.name: Customer Interaction MongoDB

dbType.name: MongoDB
dbType.sparkPattern: MongoDB Spark with sentiment analysis pipeline

nodes.description: Call centre logs, chat transcripts, app interactions, and complaint records
nodes.accessProcess:
1. Customer experience director approval
2. POPIA consent for interaction analysis
3. MongoDB read-only access
4. Sentiment analysis data handling review

details.notes:
Change streams for real-time sentiment
NLP: Sentiment and intent classification
POPIA: Interaction data with consent
Retention: 2 years for analytics
Voice: Call recordings separate, not in features

nodes.sparkPattern: MongoDB Spark with sentiment analysis pipeline

nodes.name: Product Catalog PostgreSQL

dbType.name: PostgreSQL
dbType.sparkPattern: JDBC with row-level security for product tiers

nodes.description: Mobile plans, data bundles, device offerings, and pricing structures
nodes.accessProcess:
1. Product strategy approval
2. Competitive sensitivity review
3. PostgreSQL access with RLS
4. Pricing data confidentiality agreement

details.notes:
Row-level security: Product tier access
Debezium: Product change notifications
Data: Product attributes, no customer data
Retention: Product lifecycle + 3 years
Competitive: Confidential pricing strategies

nodes.sparkPattern: JDBC with row-level security for product tiers

nodes.name: Call Detail Records S3

dbType.name: Amazon S3 (Parquet)
dbType.sparkPattern: S3A with CDR aggregation and anonymization

nodes.description: Aggregated call detail records and usage patterns for churn modeling
nodes.accessProcess:
1. Legal and regulatory compliance review
2. ICASA data retention verification
3. POPIA minimization assessment
4. S3 access with aggregation requirements
5. No individual CDRs accessible

details.notes:
Aggregation: Daily summaries, not individual calls
Anonymization: Subscriber IDs hashed
ICASA: Regulatory retention compliance
Retention: 5 years per regulations
Access: Aggregated features only, no raw CDRs
Privacy: Location cell-level, not GPS

nodes.sparkPattern: S3A with CDR aggregation and anonymization

nodes.name: Subscriber
nodes.description: Mobile subscribers with POPIA consent management and churn labels

details.notes:
POPIA: Direct marketing consent (opt-in)
ICASA: Consumer protection rights
Pseudonymization: Hash ID for analytics
Churn: Label for ML training (active/lapsed)
Tenure: Account age and loyalty
Retention: Account closure + 5 years

nodes.name: MobileDevice
nodes.description: Mobile devices and handsets with technical capabilities

details.notes:
Device types: Smartphone, Feature phone, IoT
Capabilities: 4G/5G, VoLTE, WiFi calling
TAC: Type Allocation Code for device model
Upgrade: Eligibility and propensity
No PII: Device attributes only

nodes.name: ServicePlan
nodes.description: Subscription plans, bundles, and pricing tiers

details.notes:
Plan types: Prepaid, Postpaid, Hybrid
Bundles: Data, Voice, SMS combinations
Pricing: ARPU and margin analysis
Churn: Plan-specific retention rates
Competitive: Market positioning

nodes.name: NetworkSession
nodes.description: Network usage sessions with quality of service metrics

details.notes:
Session types: Data, Voice, SMS
QoS: Quality of service scores
Location: Cell tower area (not exact)
Time: Time of day, day of week patterns
Aggregation: No individual session details

nodes.name: SubscriberLifecycleFeatures
nodes.description: Subscriber tenure, loyalty, and lifecycle stage features

details.notes:
Source: SQL Server CRM
POPIA: Consent for marketing analytics
Churn: Target variable for ML models
ICASA: Consumer protection in retention offers
Explainability: Lifecycle stage transparency
Fairness: No discriminatory pricing

nodes.name: BillingBehaviourFeatures
nodes.description: Payment patterns, billing disputes, and spend behavior

details.notes:
Source: SQL Server billing
Aggregation: Spend bands, not exact amounts
POPIA: Financial data protection
ICASA: Billing accuracy requirements
Explainability: Payment behavior factors
Target: Upsell eligibility and churn risk

nodes.name: NetworkExperienceFeatures
nodes.description: Network quality of service and device experience features

details.notes:
Source: MySQL NOC + MongoDB interactions
Aggregation: Experience scores, not raw metrics
ICASA: QoS regulatory reporting
Real-time: Network issue alerts
Churn: Service quality driver analysis
Privacy: Location cell-level only

nodes.name: ProductEngagementFeatures
nodes.description: Service plan utilization and product engagement metrics

details.notes:
Source: PostgreSQL catalog + SQL Server usage
Engagement: Product stickiness indicators
Upsell: Propensity model features
ICASA: Transparent pricing compliance
Explainability: Plan recommendation reasons
Retention: Plan optimization suggestions

nodes.name: InteractionSentimentFeatures
nodes.description: Customer interaction sentiment and service experience features

details.notes:
Source: MongoDB interactions + S3 CDR
NLP: Sentiment analysis on transcripts
Real-time: Complaint escalation alerts
POPIA: Interaction consent verified
ICASA: Complaint handling compliance
Churn: Service recovery opportunity scoring

nodes.name: ChurnPredictionModelTraining
nodes.description: Training data service for customer churn prediction and retention targeting

usedBy.name: customer-analytics-data-scientists
usedBy.description: Churn prediction model development and validation

details.notes:
Purpose: Churn prevention and customer retention
POPIA: Direct marketing consent verified
ICASA: Consumer protection in retention offers
Explainability: Churn risk factors communicated to agents
Fairness: No discriminatory retention offers
Models: Gradient boosting, Neural networks, Survival analysis
Target: 30/60/90-day churn probability

nodes.name: CustomerValueOptimization
nodes.description: ML training data for upsell, cross-sell, and lifetime value optimization

details.notes:
Purpose: Revenue optimization through relevant offers
POPIA: Marketing consent and purpose limitation
ICASA: Transparent pricing and fair treatment
Explainability: Offer relevance reasoning
Fairness: Equal access to offers, no discrimination
Models: Collaborative filtering, Uplift modeling, LTV prediction
Ethics: No vulnerable customer exploitation
